abstract: Radiosophy's HD100 pulls in HD Radio signals, a digital format that is broadcast alongside standard radio by more than 1,200 stations in this country.
snippet: Radiosophy's HD100 pulls in HD Radio signals, a digital format that is broadcast alongside standard radio by more than 1,200 stations in this country.
lead_paragraph: The cost of receiving digital AM and FM signals will drop next week as Radiosophy releases its HD100 receiver for less than $60 with a rebate. The HD100 pulls in HD Radio signals, a digital format that is broadcast alongside standard radio by more than 1,200 stations in this country. The next least expensive digital receiver is $160 with a rebate; most start at $300.

headline.main: A Digital Radio That Costs Less Than Half Its Cheapest Rival
headline.print_headline: A Digital Radio That Costs Less Than Half Its Cheapest Rival
